intro: Galium sylvestre subsp. lapeyrouseanum, commonly known as the Lapeyrouse's bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
